title: Vectors - Basic Definitions Quiz
description: Test your understanding of fundamental vector concepts and definitions.

questions.question: What are the two essential properties that define a vector?
questions.explanation: A vector has both magnitude (size/length) and direction.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a vector quantity?
questions.explanation: Temperature is a scalar quantity (has magnitude only), while velocity, force, and acceleration are vector quantities.

questions.question: What is the magnitude of the vector (3, 4, 0)?
What is a position vector?
options: A vector from the origin to a point
A vector in the xy-plane only
questions.explanation: A position vector starts from the origin (0,0,0) and ends at a specific point in space.

questions.question: When are two vectors considered equal?
options: When they have the same starting point
When they have the same magnitude and direction
When they have the same magnitude only
When they are both unit vectors
questions.explanation: Two vectors are equal if they have the same magnitude and the same direction, regardless of their starting points.
